Wisconsin Governor Scott Walker: s announcement at the White House about Foxconn's plans to build a $10 billion manufacturing facility in the state.
Foxconn: s own news release using the word "potential" in stating that the plant would create 3,000 jobs with the potential to grow to 13,000 new jobs.
Governor Walker: s qualification of the 13,000 job figure in interviews, stating that the company would not receive the full incentives unless they create 13,000 jobs.
Expert opinion from Tom Still: president of the Wisconsin Technology Council, affirming that while there may not be an absolute guarantee of 13,000 jobs, there is a strategic plan to grow to that level.
